exercise.description: Also known as dumbbell concentration curls, are a variation on traditional biceps curls.
Also known as the dumbbell hammer curl or the neutral grip dumbbell curl, is a strength training exercise that targets your biceps and forearms.
Also known as a dumbbell tricep extension, is an isolation exercise that targets your triceps muscles.
Also known as a lying triceps extension, is an isolation exercise focused on your triceps muscles.
Are a bodyweight exercise designed to build strength in your arms, shoulders, and chest. They are also known as bench dips.

exercise.equipments: chest machine or dumbbell and bench or barbell
exercise.description: Also known as a barbell bench press or a flat bench press, is a weight-training exercise that activates muscles throughout your upper body.
Primarily works the pectoralis major muscles to move the arms horizontally forward.
Are a compound exercise that works muscle groups throughout your entire body.
Also known as the incline barbell bench press and the incline chest press, is a chest workout that activates muscles throughout your upper body.
Also known as the decline chest press and the decline barbell bench press, is a powerlifting exercise that targets your lower pectoral muscles.
A strength exercise in which the trainee lowers their hips from a standing position and then stands back up.
Is a strength training exercise characterized by lifting a barbell with a hip hinge movement pattern.
Is a bodyweight exercise that works multiple muscle groups throughout your lower body, including your hamstrings, quadriceps, glutes, hip flexors, and calves.
Also known as leg curls, are isolation exercises that target the hamstring muscles on the backs of your legs.

Also known as a knee extension, is an isolation exercise focused on the quadriceps, which are made up of four specific muscles on the front of your thighâ€”the rectus femoris, vastus lateralis, vastus medialis, and vastus intermedius.

Is an upper-body exercise that involves hanging from a pull-up bar by your hands with your palms facing away from you, and lifting your entire body up with your arm and back muscles until your chest touches the bar.
Works the back muscles and is performed at a workstation with adjustable resistance, usually plates.
Also known as the barbell row and the barbell bent-over row, is a compound exercise that activates muscles throughout your upper and lower body.
Performed by holding a weight with an overhand grip and lifting it straight up to the collarbone.
Also known as the hyperextension, is an isolation exercise that targets muscles in your back.
With your hands behind your head, lift your shoulder blades off the mat. Raise your knees to a 90-degree angle and alternate extending your legs as if pedaling a bike.
Also known as the straight leg raise or the lying leg raise, is a bodyweight exercise that targets your abdominal muscles, particularly the lower abs.
Is a bodyweight exercise that targets your core muscles; specifically the obliques on the sides of your abdomen.
Is a core exercise performed by lying face-up and raising your hips and lower back with your abdominal muscles in a controlled manner.
Is a core exercise that works your abdominal muscles, especially your transverse abdominis as well as your internal and external obliques.
